column4: When Ubuntu gets upgraded and Gnome 2 is removed, do you think there will be a way to reinstall it? I really can't get used to Unity for some reason...
you might want to consider debian at that point
is Debian as user-friendly as Ubuntu?
I would love to compare my xfce/debian screenshots with your gnome/ubuntu <smile>
could you show me? I really want to know if there something wrong with XFCE as I installed it...
pastebin won't handle pix, I think
How long did it take you to theme it up all nice like that?
I had to untar two theme packages and set up the panels the way I wanted...maybe half an hour
Oh that's not too bad....does XFCE come on the Live CD?
you can just load xfce to your present ubuntu install...no need to get a new cd
How would I do this? Via Synaptic?
yes, just load xfce4 and thunar. there are other parts to xfce (xfburn, ristretto, etc) but those two will ge tyou started
after installing xfce4, log out and at the login screen Session menu choose xfce
